user.biography: Greenpeace exists because this fragile earth deserves a voice. It needs solutions. It needs change. It needs action.

node.text:
Fishermen on the outskirts of Matadi, in the Democratic Republic of Congo, say plastic is threatening their livelihoods. Not only does plastic pollution end up in their nets, but in the fish they catch. The most vulnerable communities are often impacted the worst by plastic pollution.
#PlasticFreeSeptember #BreakFreeFromPlastic

node.text:
50 years ago this month a crew of activists set out to sail into the path of a nuclear bomb blast and created Greenpeace. 
.
Over five decades – on all continents and oceans – together we have spoken truth to power, borne witness, stopped, blocked and placed our bodies in the way of environmental destruction. We have investigated and documented ecological contamination and crime. We have conducted scientific studies, litigated and lobbied. We have tried, failed and tried again. We have also succeeded!
.
As we commemorate, and celebrate, 50 years since the Greenpeace set sail, we are painfully aware of the gathering storm wrought by inequity, greed and corruption, of accelerating habitat destruction and the deepening climate emergency. We look to the past for learnings on how to face the future. We celebrate the passion and commitment of all who make Greenpeace possible 💚
.
.
#HopeInAction #GP50th #Greenpeace50

node.text:
Air pollution is a silent killer, responsible for an estimated 7 million deaths globally each year, and a leading cause of lung cancer, heart disease, stroke and asthma. 

But it is also a problem that we know how to solve, and we are demanding that governments take action. Join us in sharing your air pollution story using the hashtag #CleanAirNow. 
.
.
#WorldCleanAirDay #HealthyAirHealthyPlanet #airpollution #greenpeace

node.title: Tell us your air pollution story

node.text:
It’s one of the world’s most treasured natural jewels, but the Great Barrier Reef is losing its beautiful colours. 
.
This is what the coal industry is doing to one of Australia's most remarkable natural wonders.
.
.
#greenpeace #reef #GBR #Australia #climatechange #globalwarming

node.title: Great Barrier Reef is losing its beautiful colours.

node.text:
Earlier this week, thousands of Indigenous Peoples marched to the Brazilian Congress to symbolically demarcate Brasília with 1,296 signs representing all the Indigenous Lands claimed by Indigenous Peoples in Brazil, in a protest against the government's refusal on demarcating Indigenous Lands.
Around 6,000 Indigenous Peoples have gathered this week at the Struggle for Life camp to fight for their lands and lives. 
.
.
.
.
#StruggleForLife #IndigenousEmergency #MarcoTemporalNão

node.title: Protest for the Demarcation of Indigenous Lands in Brazil

node.text:
More than 5,000 Indigenous leaders from all over the country are meeting at the #StruggleforLife camp in Brasilia this week to defend their rights against the anti-Indigenous agenda that advances in Brazil’s Congress and await a critical Supreme Court decision that will define the future for their lives, their lands and for the environmental conservation in Brazil. Forests thrive when Indigenous Rights are respected✊
.
.
.
.
#IndigenousEmergency #LutaPelaVida #MarcoTemporalNão

node.title: Struggle for Life Camp 2021 in Brasília, Brazil

node.text:
If the world is on fire, you don’t throw more fuel on it.

That’s what we’re doing by allowing the expansion of fossil fuel production.

How about a non-proliferation treaty... on fossil fuels?

via @fossilfueltreaty

#fossilfueltreaty #nonproliferation #fossilfuels #bigoil #oilcompanies #climateemergency #climatecrisis #biodiversitycrisis #humanrights #climatejustice #solutions #coalphaseout #fossilfuelphaseout #energy #climate #climateaction

node.title: Towards a fossil fuel non-proliferation treaty?

node.text:
The Sámi people, the only existing Indigenous People in the EU, live in the northern part of what today is Scandinavia, Finland and Russia.

The Sámi community in Muonio is now fighting for their way of life. The Swedish state-owned forestry giant Sveaskog, is clearcutting huge areas in their lands, devastating traditional livelihoods, destroying biodiversity, and further eroding nature’s ability to combat climate change.

The community issued an ultimatum, demanding that Sveaskog stops ALL activities in the area, at least until proper consultation with the community. 

Will you help them to make Sveaskog listen? Tag @sveaskog  in the comments.

#sveaskog #sweden #scandinavia #forests #forestprotection #Sami #SamiPeople #IndigenousPeoples #landrights #humanrights #deforestation #forestdestruction #reindeerherding #biodiversitycrisis #climatecrisis

node.title: Stand with the Sámi for the forests!

node.text:
#floods and intense tropical storms have wreaked havoc in cities across the world.
.
But this could get worse. Ten years from now, cities like Jakarta and Taipei could be seriously affected by typhoons and rising sea levels, putting the lives of millions of people at risk.
How much it will rise depends mostly on the rate of future carbon dioxide emissions and global warming. Hope lies in action. Governments and leaders must take an immediate climate action to prevent this worst impact of climate change.
Share this video.
.
.
.
#ClimateEmergency #2030SeaLevelRise #ExtremeSeaLevelRise #climatechange #jakarta

node.title: The sea is rising higher and faster

node.text:
We know we need to rapidly move from oil and gas to renewable energy. But what happens to oil workers? 🤔 

At the moment, lots of people’s livelihoods are tied to polluting industries. Think oil and gas workers, aviation engineers, factory workers making petrol and diesel vehicles.

If we want to avoid catastrophic climate change, these polluting industries are going to have to change completely. Some of them will have to shrink. And these changes will impact the lives of these workers and their communities.

We have to move to an environmentally sustainable economy without leaving workers in polluting industries behind. Moving to a clean economy is a mammoth task that will also create millions of jobs around the world ⚖️🌍

We need governments to side with oil workers and the climate, not oil bosses 📢

Link in bio ☝️

#climatecrisis #climateemergency #climatejustice #socialjustice #fightinequality #energy #workers #protectworkers #livesbeforeprofits #oilworkers #gasworkers #rigged #greenpeace #greenpeaceuk #uk #documentary #justtransition #transition #greentransition #cleaneconomy #greenjobs #fossilfuels #greenrecovery #justrecovery #buildbackbetter

node.text:
'Take great care of Mother Earth.' These words from Pope Francis are words to live by, no matter where we are, or what we believe in.

Last Friday, a team from @greenpeacehu shared this message far and wide on a hot-air balloon, as a greeting to Pope Francis, who visited Hungary over the weekend.

Right now, we’re facing an ecological and climate emergency, and we all need to work together to demand system change, to take great care of Mother Earth, for us all.
.
.
#Climate #ClimateEmergency

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Greenpeace International 🌍 on September 13, 2021. May be an image of nature.

node.text:
Every second breath we take comes from the oceans. To protect our shared oceans, @Greenpeace calls to challenge industrial fisheries and for vast sanctuaries to be created to replenish them.
.
 © @paulhiltonphoto 
.
.
50 years ago, a crew of activists set out to sail into the path of a nuclear bomb blast, and Greenpeace was born. This year, we would like to commemorate 50 years of hard lessons, sweet victories, and the incredible people who have always been the heart of Greenpeace. 

#Greenpeace50 #Greenpeace

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Greenpeace International 🌍 in Australia.

node.text:
The Great Barrier Reef is one of the most beautiful places on earth. Its shallow seas and coral networks stretch 2,300km along Australia's Pacific coast. But it is under unprecedented threat. When ocean temperatures stay too warm for too long, corals expel the algae (zooxanthellae) living in their tissues, going completely white. Several coral bleaching events in the Australian summer of 2016, and again in 2017, killed at least 26% of the Reef’s corals.
.
 © Abram Powell 
.
.
50 years ago, a crew of activists set out to sail into the path of a nuclear bomb blast, and Greenpeace was born. This year, we would like to commemorate 50 years of hard lessons, sweet victories, and the incredible people who have always been the heart of Greenpeace. 
.
#Greenpeace50 #Greenpeace #reef

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Greenpeace International 🌍 in Straußberg, Thuringen, Germany. May be an image of nature and text.

node.text:
Wind turbines standing strong over the clouds near Straussberg (Brandenburg) in Germany. 
.
A big part of Greenpeace’s core values is to promote solutions. It’s not enough for us to point the finger - we develop, research, and promote concrete steps towards a green and peaceful future for all of us.
.
Greenpeace believes that greenhouse gas emissions must start falling immediately and be halved by 2030 to give the best chance of limiting average global temperature rise to 1.5C. This means that coal, the most polluting fossil fuel, has to be rapidly phased out. Renewable energy projects such as this one in Germany must be accelerated if we are to halt runaway climate change. 
.
© Paul Langrock
.
.
50 years ago, a crew of activists set out to sail into the path of a nuclear bomb blast, and Greenpeace was born. This year, we would like to commemorate 50 years of hard lessons, sweet victories, and the incredible people who have always been the heart of Greenpeace. 

#Greenpeace50 #Greenpeace

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Greenpeace International 🌍 in Arc de Triomphe , Paris. May be an image of outdoors.

node.text:
Nonviolent direct action is at the heart of Greenpeace and has been a constant over the last 50 years. Such actions have taken many forms over the years and around the world but have always embodied this idea: The optimism of the action is better than the pessimism of the thought. We rekindle and stoke the fires of hope by continuously committing to making a change in the world.
.
Greenpeace activists created a solar symbol around the world-famous Paris landmark, the Arc de Triomphe in December 2015, by painting the roads yellow with a non-polluting water-based paint to reveal the image of a huge shining sun. The action coincided with COP21 and reminded politicians and governments that whatever they agree in Paris, the only credible way to beat climate change is to support and increase renewables energy systems.
.
.

node.text:
Fishermen on the outskirts of Matadi, in the Democratic Republic of Congo, say plastic is threatening their livelihoods. Not only does plastic pollution end up in their nets, but in the fish they catch. The most vulnerable communities are often impacted the worst by plastic pollution.
#PlasticFreeSeptember #BreakFreeFromPlastic

node.text:
Greenpeace and Tcktcktck volunteers raise a wind turbine on the beach at dawn in Durban, South Africa. Greenpeace believes that greenhouse gas emissions must start falling now, and be halved by 2030, to give the best chance of limiting average global temperature rise to 1.5C. This means that coal, the most polluting fossil fuel, has to be rapidly phased out. 
.
© @shaynepix
.
.
50 years ago, a crew of activists set out to sail into the path of a nuclear bomb blast, and Greenpeace was born. This year, we would like to commemorate 50 years of hard lessons, sweet victories, and the incredible people who have always been the heart of Greenpeace. 

#Greenpeace50 #Greenpeace

node.text:
A big part of Greenpeace’s core values is to promote solutions. It’s not enough for us to point the finger - we develop, research, and promote concrete steps towards a green and peaceful future for all of us.
.
1st Image: Children playing under a solar panel in Bihar, India. In 2014, @Greenpeace India and partners BASIX and CEED developed a 100 kW solar micro-grid that supplies around-the-clock electricity to more than 2,400 residents, 450 homes, and 50 commercial operations, including two schools and a healthcare facility. The reliable and quick-to-install micro-grid provided a good model for communities anywhere living without reliable electricity supplies.
.
2nd Image: This is one of Spain’s largest solar power plants, located in Sanlucar la Mayor, near Seville. Each of these mirrors has a surface measuring 120 square meters (1,290 square feet) that concentrates the sun's rays to the top of a 115 meter (377 feet) high tower where a solar receiver and a steam turbine are located. The turbine drives a generator, producing electricity. 
.
© Vivek M @drvivekm, © @markelredondo
.
.

node.text:
Greenpeace’s mission is to ensure the ability of the earth to nurture life in all its diversity, which means protecting biodiversity in all its forms. An essential part of our campaigns is the documentation of the natural world. 
.
The Congo Basin Forest in central Africa is one of the most important places in the world to help reduce the effects of climate change. A huge peatland, which locks tonnes of carbon beneath the forest floor, was discovered in the region in 2017. 
.
@Greenpeace calls for the Congo Basin to be protected so that it continues to be an incredibly rich and diverse ecosystem that provides food, fresh water, shelter and medicine for tens of millions of people and a home to endangered wildlife species.
.
© Daniel Beltrá @danielbeltraphoto
.

node.text:
Greenpeace’s mission is to ensure the ability of the earth to nurture life in all its diversity, which means protecting biodiversity in all its forms. An essential part of our campaigns is the documentation of the natural world. 
.
1st Image: Banner Action on Christ Statue in Rio de Janeiro in March 2009. Greenpeace activists unfurl a banner from the famous Christ the Redeemer statue in Rio de Janeiro to call on governments to protect global biodiversity at the Convention of Biological Diversity (CBD) that took place in Curitiba, Brazil. 
.
2nd Image: Scarlet ibis birds filled the sky above flooded lowlands, approximately 20 miles southwest of Bom Amigo along the coast of Brazil in February 2017. Greenpeace was in the area campaigning to protect the recently discovered Amazon Reef off the coast of Brazil from development by oil companies.
.
Amazon is a biodiversity hotspot and has a crucial role for the world’s climate, storing 80 to 120 billion tonnes of carbon. Greenpeace has worked with local communities to save the Amazon forest from dam projects that threaten their livelihood and the health of our planet. 
.
 © Daniel Beltrá @danielbeltraphoto
.
.

The Amazon is the biggest remaining rainforest on Earth. Hundreds of local and Indigenous communities live in the Amazon of Brazil, Peru and Ecuador. They hold the key to end deforestation and protect the rainforest. 
.

node.text:
Indonesia’s rainforests are one of nature’s strongest defenses against climate change. They also provide a livelihood for many millions of people and a home to endangered species like sumatran tigers, elephants and orangutans. But right now, these forests are being destroyed to make way for palm oil plantations - pushing these species to the brink of extinction and causing annual fires that cloak the region in a dangerous haze. Palm oil can be grown without destroying rainforests. Palm oil traders and corporations that use palm oil in their products ranging from soaps to cookies must take responsibility for their inaction. Greenpeace demands that profits are not prized over people and nature.
.
Palm oil can be grown without destroying rainforests. Palm oil traders and corporations that use palm oil in products ranging from soaps to cookies must take responsibility for their inaction. Over 1.2 million people this year are standing with Greenpeace and demanding corporations drop dirty palm oil. 
.
 © Bjorn Vaugn / BOSF, © @uletifan 
.
